definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: I think you should just admit that you're a big softy .
sentences.chinese: 呃，我觉得你得承认自己挺多愁善感。

sentences.english: They should take to swimming like, er, a duck to water.
sentences.chinese: 呃，它们本应该像鸭子一般在水里游泳。

sentences.english: But I was, I wasn't able to join this semester
sentences.chinese: 但是我，呃，我这个学期不能参加。

sentences.english: So I was in a club called Ivy, which was, uh, the last year,
sentences.chinese: 我参加过一个叫常春藤的俱乐部，呃，那是去年了。

sentences.english: Ummm, a little experiment to see where you'd draw the line.
sentences.chinese: 呃，就想试验一下你的底线在哪里？

sentences.english: He used such mannerism as “er” and “uh” to fill in a pause.
sentences.chinese: 他说话间歇时总爱用“呃”“嗯”之类的话搭头。

sentences.english: Talk to the audience? Ugh. This is always death.
sentences.chinese: 和听众对话？呃。这基本上没用。

sentences.english: Duh. I felt like an idiot.
sentences.chinese: 呃，我感觉像自己是个白痴。

sentences.english: Well, ma 'am, now I am happy to congratulate you.
sentences.chinese: 呃，太太，我很高兴，现在我可以给您道喜啦。

sentences.english: Um, I think there's something that Jean and I learned from our failed marriage.
sentences.chinese: 呃，我想我和简，从我们失败的婚姻中学到一个教训。

sentences.english: You know, Tallahassee and Columbus are both, uh, east.
sentences.chinese: 你看，那个，塔拉哈西和哥伦布，都在，呃，东边。

sentences.english: Well, Adriana says, "Take this guy, Kevin."
sentences.chinese: 呃，阿德里亚纳说，“比如，凯文。

sentences.english: Thanks. Uh, would my camera be all right in the overhead compartment?
sentences.chinese: 谢谢。呃，我的照相机放在上面行李柜里没问题吧？

sentences.english: We just want to give you a heads up .
sentences.chinese: 呃，我们只是想给你提个醒。

sentences.english: Yeah, well, we hope we are doing a bit more than that.
sentences.chinese: 是的，呃，其实我们希望我们所做的还比那多一点。

definition: interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
oh (expression of agreement or surprise)/(Cantonese) not
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
auxiliary showing sth happened in the past
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
